timeline.bodyText: Just a clarifying question: is maxMemory the sum of max heap size and max direct memory size?
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText:
Hi Casey,
The maxMemory is close to -Xmx, based on my test(1%-5% less).
I assumed it's heap+direct memory. Because in our previous heap OOM, where 32GB Xmx was set, most of heap OOM's heap dump were much smaller than 32GB(12GB or 20GB). So I thought Xms includes heap + direct, then maxMemory should be the max for heap + direct.
However, I double checked Xms option, it's heap only. This answer also states it doesn't include direct memory.
I am confused now, if Xms is heap only, why our heap dumps are much less than 32GB?

For this PR, I can revise the code to return heap usage only in getMemoryPercentage(will be renamed to getHeapMemoryPercentage), and add getDirectMemoryPercentage in next PR(haven't got a good way to get max direct memory.)
replies.author: zzmao

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure why our heap dumps are smaller. It could be the difference between a full heap dump that also includes yet-to-be garbage collected objects and a regular heap dump.
replies.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText:
Found this: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3773775/default-for-xxmaxdirectmemorysize
looks like our servers doesn't specify xxmaxdirectmemorysize so total allocation for heap+direct is 2*Runtime.getRuntime().maxMemory()
replies.author: zzmao

replies.bodyText:
I wonder if we could either read the property xxmaxdirectmemorysize or, if it is not set, use max heap size.
We do set this property on ambry-server to support in memory indexes, but likely not on ambry-frontend.
replies.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText:
We could.
sun.misc.VM.maxDirectMemory()
If xxmaxdirectmemorysize is not set, it returns the same value of Runtime.getRuntime().maxMemory(). If set, it returns the value of xxmaxdirectmemorysize.
Tested in my local, returned expected value.
replies.author: zzmao

replies.bodyText: The only problem with sun packages is that they are private-ish (SDK internal) APIs, and there are problems accessing them in java 11: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53543062/replace-access-to-sun-misc-vm-for-jdk-11
replies.author: cgtz
zzmao

replies.bodyText: Yeah maybe that's the best approach. If it is set, use the value of the vm option, if not set, use the heap size.
